intro: Odontandra quadrijuga, commonly known as the four-winged odontandra, is a rare and distinctive plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique, four-winged seed pods that give it its common name. The plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and features compound leaves with alternating leaflets. Its flowers are small and typically yellow or green, adapting to its natural habitat in dry, rocky environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
